content.description: Climbs the South face of the chossy looking block uphill to the left of the Missing link. The rock is better than it appears from a distance.
content.protection: Medium sized cams and 6 foot runners for the anchor.
content.location: From Longs cracks, go to the right until you reach a gap in the rocks. Proceed across a hanging meadow toward the massive boulder to the north (the missing link). Wild Turkey is the Block uphill and left.

content.description:
Great arete climb! east facing arete, stand start with matched hands in sloping dish left side of the oak tree, work up sloping arete using few feet and heel hooks to the top point then swing feet to the otherside of the point for a good mantle.

There is also an ending variation which insteaded if mantling, continue traversing the lip to the next high point.
content.location: If standing at the start of the missing link problem, walk 15 feet up (north) on the the trail and on your left will be a boulder. Walk up to the boulder and take the trail heading right.

content.description: Smear and edge your way up the smooth west face of The Missing Link boulder past two bolts.  Only two bolts on this climb that were most likely placed on lead.  The moves getting to the bolts are easy with the cruxes coming just after clipping them.
content.protection: Two lead bolts and a double bolt anchor with rap chains on top which were all recently replaced thanks to ASCA.
content.location: Walk past the Longs Cracks on the downhill side (east side).  Follow a faint trail north across the slabs towards the huge boulder on the other side.  The Missing Link is on the west face of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start on pair of scoops on left side of flaring crack. Left hand to dish/pocket in crack, right hand up to sloping shelf. Left hand moves up to side pull, then follow sloping shelf out right to crimps and finish on corner horn right of capstone
content.location: Same boulder as Chameleon just nw of red stagger in the missing link area

content.description: Start matched on lowest rail in the hole, a couple campus moves will get you set up to finish. Short but fun, exit left or right.
content.location: neighboring boulder on east side of large boulder

content.description: This is a nice clean slab with several variations available 5.9 to easy 5.10
content.protection: 2 TR bolts on top, spaced to cover any variations without undue swing involved.
content.location: From the checkered Demon go downhill bearing somewhat north, following an obvious track to a large, sloping rock patio. Good for the soul is the big clean face at the north end of the patio. Several variations on the face.

content.description: start at seam/crack on right side and head up left.
content.protection: pads or two anchors at top
content.location: to the right of checkered demon

content.description:
squat start lower right on shield (vertical jugs)and move left in a variety of ways until you reach a big jug half way, from there a gaston move into the seam/crack then up to the top (crux).

can also dyno from big jug but a badish landing is involved
content.protection: a few pads and spotter or two anchors at top to TR
content.location: neighboring boulder on east side of missing link boulder

content.description: Sit start at pair of scoops in flairing crack, then move left hand high up to sloper dish/crack inside the flairing crack and match, continue up and left on block features.
content.location: from red stagger go north on the trail and quickly go left or west, soon you'll come to a short slab, once at the top you'll see the flairing crack. (red stagger and chameleon are pretty close to each other)

content.description: start on rotting wood (careful), smear on rock, follow crack up for topout
content.location: if facing checkered demon, it is directly behind (slabby, not tall)
